meanings.definition: A tube or lip projecting from a container, through which liquid can be poured or discharged.
meanings.sent1: The teapot had a small spout for pouring tea.
meanings.sent2: She carefully poured the milk from the spout of the jug.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to drink from the spout of the watering can.
meanings.sent4: The fountain's spout danced in the sunlight, spraying water in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The chocolate fountain's spout was a tempting sight at the party.

meanings.sent1: During the debate, he would spout his opinions loudly.
meanings.sent2: She tends to spout nonsense when she's nervous.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to spout a few words after listening to the radio.
meanings.sent4: The politician continued to spout promises without any real plans.
meanings.sent5: He would spout jokes to lighten the mood in the room.

meanings.definition: To flow out in a stream.
meanings.sent1: The water began to spout from the broken pipe.
meanings.sent2: The oil spouted from the well uncontrollably.
meanings.sent3: The soda can spouted its contents all over the table when opened.
meanings.sent4: The geyser spouted hot water high into the air.
meanings.sent5: The whale spouted water from its blowhole as it surfaced.
